ai-tha-ap83:0.3_0: The Elder Tissa related the Pale-Maker
ai-tha-ap83:1.1_0: “One from the bank of the river,
ai-tha-ap83:1.3_0: sitting having seen the ascetic, as he was sitting on his own seat,
ai-tha-ap83:2.1_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
ai-tha-ap83:3.1_0: I’ll be able to do what is unsuitable
ai-tha-ap83:3.4_0: he will be extinguished, and he will go away.
ai-tha-ap83:5.1_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap83:5.3_0: I paid homage at the teacher’s feet,
ai-tha-ap83:6.1_0: for a long time, asking me,
ai-tha-ap83:6.2_0: that the king of beasts might ruin me.
ai-tha-ap83:7.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap83:7.2_0: it was all over the flower.
ai-tha-ap83:7.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap83:7.4_0: this carpet is full of fruit.
ai-tha-ap83:8.2_0: beings live in a great forest grove.
ai-tha-ap83:9.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap83:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Timbara.
ai-tha-ap83:11.1_0: First the Elder Timiya of Timbaruka
